term.title: reversible network

item.text: Polymer network that forms or breaks up as the temperature is changed or under the action of a force.

notes.item: The junction points in a reversible network are usually small crystallites or glassy domains such as those formed within block copolymers.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 1801. 'Definitions of terms relating to the structure and processing of sols, gels, networks, and inorganic-organic hybrid materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2007)' on page 1815 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779101801)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
